DataElement.preferredName: Prior Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Neoplastic Cell Detection Other Method Occurrence Therapies Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe other tumor cell detection methods prior to the hematopoietic cell transplantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Neoplastic Cell Detection Other Method Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.) ._Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._Cells of, or derived from, a tumor._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Prior Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Neoplastic Cell Detection
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual.:Cells of, or derived from, a tumor.:No value exists.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
Cells of, or derived from, a tumor.
The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: released as entered during ISO compliance update

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping

ReferenceDocuments.name: Specify other tumor cell dete
ReferenceDocuments.description: Specify other tumor cell detection method used prior to HCST

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping for CDE:2778231
ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedObservation.methodCode WHERE PerformedObservation > DefinedObservation.nameCode = "Detect Tumor Cell" AND DefinedObservation [detect] > DefinedCompositionRelationship > DefinedProcedure [overall HCT process] AND DefinedSubstanceAdminsitration [transfusion] > DefinedCompositionRelationship > DefinedObservation [overall HCT process] AND DefinedCompositionRelationship.sequenceNumber [detect] < DefinedCompositionRelationship.sequenceNumber [transfusion]
